sense.name: attach with or as if with tacks
sense.examples: When the Wrights were prepared to fly, they tacked a large red flag on the side. Do all rugs and runners have non-skid backing or are they tacked down? He tacked a $50 wireless router on to the network, They tacked a prohibition on smoking onto a completely unrelated bill.

sense.name: fix pieces together loosely
sense.examples: She tacked the sleeves into the armholes of the dress. He tacked together some random phrases and called it poetry.

sense.name: change direction (by turning into the wind)
sense.commentary: Note: Be careful not to tag nominalizations.
sense.examples: The sailors decided to tack the boat. The boat tacked easily and was soon back up to eight knots. He was a patsy of the left-- who dumped him the instant he tacked right.

sense.name: add on to an amount
sense.examples: Bankers Trust tacked on 1 1/8, to 44 5/8. Standard and Poor's 500-stock index tacked on 2.52 points, to 273.50.
